授業目的:
This research seminar will build on the academic inquiries
begun in Research I for writing and completing the graduation thesis.
関連科目: Completed Research Seminar I. Highly recommend taking/completion of courses related to Climate Justice and/or Intercultural relations and minority issues (these courses can be taken con-currently). Student’s curiosity and interest in climate change, population health, just transition, international relations, intercultural relations and minority issues, and/or Christianity and social justice welcomed.
授業方法:
Consultative learning tailored to individual
student learning goals, timelines, and writing.

第1回:
Introduction session - updates and planning.
Creative design and timelines to unfold in consultation with the students. Tailored to individual and collective needs, progress, and timing.
トピック.授業計画1:
Co-designed with students enabling progression throughout the year with a flow as follows:

April-May: Any data collection and beginnings of analyses

June-July: Writing! Presentations. 

September-October: Writing, edits, and refining! Poster presentation.

November-December: More writing and edits, and completion of graduation thesis! Executive summary and presentations.
トピック.授業外学習2: The completion of the graduation thesis is our shared goal. Students are expected to take initiative, engage with the chosen topic, take leadership in researching and writing.                 In-class sessions may become less regular as more writing time is needed.                             Also, time and effort will be taken to prepare for poster and presentations to share research progress and findings with other students.

学生による授業評価の方法Course Evaluation by Student: Feedback at mid-term and year's end.

Each course is positioned within the curriculum in accordance with the diploma policy and curriculum policy established by each undergraduate/graduate school. By proceeding with the study of this course with an awareness of the DP and CP, the following abilities expected by each undergraduate/graduate school will be developed.Research Seminars:1. Understanding and analytical skills regarding international issues: the ability to understand and analyze various regions of the world from different perspectives in the humanities and social sciences.2. Problem-solving skills: the ability to proactively identify problems and solve them based on appropriate methods.3. Intercultural understanding and multicultural coexistence: the ability to be sensitive to different cultures and to coexist with diverse cultures.4. Ethical Values: Acquiring it though ‘liberal arts education for human growth’ based on Christian principles.
On-going - verbal and in writing - direct edits to writing also in this quest to complete the graduation thesis.
